result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard Curtis Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leonard Curtis Parker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leonard Curtis Parker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court orders that all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, DNA sample and surcharge be paid in 6 months, 2-5-2016, and if not a civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard Curtis Parker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonard Curtis Parker in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Leonard Curtis Parker in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is unable to proceed as to count 1.  Defense moves to dismiss that count which is granted by the court.
AS to count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as  and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 120 days time served.  Court orders that all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, DNA sample and surcharge be paid in 6 months, 2-5-2016, and if not a civil judgment to be entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Leonard Curtis Parker not in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld
Court vacates Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bail.   mld

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Leonard Curtis Parker not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer received by defense counsel.  Upon the motion of the State, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposesof trial: Cases 2015CM807 and 2015CM1210.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-18-2015 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 8-5-2015 at 8:30 am.  

*** Court vacates Justice Point Supervision as a condition of bail.  mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to maintain Absolute Sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: Tina P.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leonard Curtis Parker in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Leonard Curtis Parker in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04 due to lower pending case 15CM807.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonard Curtis Parker
Current: 8001 W Villard Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 04-07-2015)
Prior: 7963 N 94th St, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
